Subjective: Sore throat x 3 days, unbearable pain with swallowing. Fever this morning. Started with cough last week, now resolved. Took paracetamol, ibuprofen, but pain persists. Impact: Unbearable pain with swallowing. No shortness of breath, no runny nose, no current cough. No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Request: Wants antibiotics, concerned about abscess (friend had one), wants faster symptom relief.
Objective: Temp 38.3Â°C (after 2 paracetamol this morning). SpO2 98%. Ears: Left: Air-filled eardrum, no inflammation. Right: Slight redness in ear canal, otherwise normal, no inflammation. Neck: Small submandibular lymph nodes, not pathological. Throat: Median uvula, slightly red pharyngeal arch, slightly enlarged tonsils (not kissing), little slough on both sides. No abscess suspected. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no additional sounds.
Assessment: Suspected viral pharyngitis/tonsillitis. No signs of abscess or bacterial infection.
Plan: Explanation: Likely viral infection, antibiotics not indicated/helpful. Antibiotics may only shorten symptoms by half a day.
- Contact if much sicker, shortness of breath, or unable to swallow properly.
